<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of this morning, the presidential race has yet to be decided. Full coverage below. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/03/2020-presidential-race-big-fat-tbd?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Really Matters Is That Everyone Had Fun
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Map of electoral college" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDIxL21hcF9vZl9lbGVjdG9yYWxfY29sbGVnZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NPR</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like your next haircut, house party, or pretty much anything else in 2020, the presidential election is TBD. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where things stand </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of this newsletter’s send time, President Trump had 213 electoral college votes and Joe Biden had 238, per the Associated Press. A candidate needs 270 to win.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Biden </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/u-stock-futures-jump-rally-231812115.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">swept</a></span><span> northeastern states while Trump notched wins in typically Republican parts of the South and Midwest. Trump won battlegrounds Florida, Ohio, and Iowa. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Associated Press called Arizona for Biden, the first state to be flipped from its 2016 outcome. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This election saw record turnout, including a crush of mail-in ballots that will <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/11/04/931136905/we-ll-be-working-24-hours-vote-counting-to-continue-through-the-week?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take time to count</a> in swing states Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and Michigan—those states don’t allow election officials to get much or any counting done before Election Day. North Carolina, Georgia, and Maine were also too close to call at the Brew’s send time. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reaction:</strong> President Trump <a href="https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-elections-us-supreme-court-25762f69b27dfbccc4fd8077fb5fdc91?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">falsely claimed</a> victory and said he would bring the fight to the Supreme Court, though it’s not clear what that means. Biden advised patience in an address to his supporters. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The market reaction</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors are left scratching their heads over calculations around the balance of power between the president and Congress and the likelihood of another round of economic stimulus. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Although many polls favored Biden, the race isn’t playing out decisively in his favor, forcing investors to price in other outcomes on the fly. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At one point last night, betting markets that had long favored Biden swung to favor Trump. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>we could be waiting on ballot counts for days or even weeks, and legal challenges may prolong the process even further. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F03%2F2020-presidential-race-big-fat-tbd" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+race+was+too+close+to+call+Wednesday+morning+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/03/2020-presidential-race-big-fat-tbd&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/03/majority-control-us-senate-still-undecided?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Chambers of Secrets
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of the Capitol building under a blue sky." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDIyL2NvbmdyZXNzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All 435 seats in the House and 35 in the Senate put their fates in voters’ hands yesterday. Don’t worry, we won’t talk about them all. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Republicans went into Election Day with a 53-seat Senate majority. Will Mitch McConnell, who handily won his reelection, return as majority leader? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Republicans <a href="https://apps.npr.org/elections20-interactive/#/senate?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">secured 47 seats</a> as of 6am, and six races are still awaiting final calls (all have GOP incumbents). Other highlights:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Seats in Colorado and Alabama were the first flips, switching to Democrat and Republican, respectively. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>NASA astronaut Mark Kelly pulled off a high-profile W for Dems in Arizona, flipping the state.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At least one of Georgia’s Senate races is </span><span><a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/addybaird/georgia-senate-runoff-kelly-loeffler-raphael-warnock?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heading to a Jan. 5 runoff</a></span><span>, so we may not know the chamber’s final balance of power until then. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The House?</strong> Democrats <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/politics/republicans-democrats-control-of-house-senate-2020-election?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retained</a> their majority and may add a few seats. As of 6am, there are 67 races awaiting final results. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The “blue wave” of Democrats some investors were expecting to sweep both chambers <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/stock-market-hope-for-a-blue-wave-election-day-outcome-washes-out-11604472261?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hasn’t materialized</a> (at least not yet). </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or, as state election ballots called them yesterday, propositions. Here are the results from this year’s biggest biz-related ballot measures...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Legal weed: </strong>New Jersey and Arizona <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/04/1-in-3-americans-lives-where-recreational-marijuana-legal-434004?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legalized</a> recreational marijuana use, while South Dakota and Mississippi approved medical marijuana. Now, one in three Americans live in a state where adults can legally buy pot. And Oregon decided to <a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/11/3/21514828/oregon-drug-decriminalization-measure-110-results?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decriminalize</a> the use of <em>all </em>drugs (including heroin and cocaine). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gig economy: </strong>Uber, Lyft, and DoorDash’s hugely expensive Prop 22 <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/04/california-election-voters-prop-22-uber-lyft?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed</a> in California. The ballot measure directly challenged a recent state law that required these companies to classify their drivers as employees, not independent contractors. Uber and Lyft had warned earlier this year they could suspend their services in CA over the law. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Real estate: </strong>Let’s go back to California for this one. Prop 15, which would lift longtime tax protections for commercial property owners, is <a href="https://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2020/11/04/prop-15-challenge-to-ca-property-tax-rules-trailing-prop-19-wildfire-tax-break-too-early-to-call/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trailing</a> as of early this morning. The current system puts a tight cap on property tax increases even if the value of the property rises disproportionately. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Work:</strong> Floridians voted to <a href="https://www.wtsp.com/article/news/politics/elections/florida-voters-approve-amendment-2-minimum-wage-hike/67-d9204880-a630-4d40-8a46-658f6e450518?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise</a> the minimum wage to $15 by 2026 and Colorado will <a href="https://www.denverpost.com/2020/11/03/colorado-prop-118-results-paid-family-leave/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">establish</a> a progressive family and medical leave program. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPOS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/03/ant-group-ipo-scrapped?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
All the Little Ants Stop Listing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='An ant killer spray bottle that reads "IPO repellant" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDE1L2lwb19yZXBlbGxhbnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Shanghai Stock Exchange <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/03/ant-group-ipo-in-shanghai-suspended.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called off</a> Ant Group’s extremely un-antish IPO slated for Thursday.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The public debut was expected to be the largest ever, raising at least $34 billion at a valuation north of $310 billion. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ant had planned to list in both Shanghai and Hong Kong, but it nixed Hong Kong after Shanghai pulled out.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s Ant Group again? </strong>An affiliate of sprawling Chinese conglomerate Alibaba, Ant is a fintech company...in the same way that Serena Williams is a ping-pong player. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Ant has ruffled some dangerous feathers: the Chinese government’s. In a recent speech, Alibaba cofounder Jack Ma <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/11/03/930799521/regulators-squash-giant-ant-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made critical comments</a> about the country’s financial regulatory system. Then on Monday, four regulators summoned Ma and Ant Group’s top execs for a chat. We don’t know what was said, but it probably wasn’t “keep criticizing us.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ant Group and the government are frenemies; the Chinese Communist Party </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/03/tech/ant-ipo-postponed-beijing-jack-ma/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wants to cultivate</a></span><span> the country’s capital markets...but not to the point where it’ll tolerate dissent.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Ant may still IPO, but it’ll have to pull off some major reorganizing to get right with regulators.   </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this game, we’ll show you a property listed on Zillow, and you have to determine the estimated market value. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Introducing <a href="https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/1600-Pennsylvania-Ave-NW-Washington-DC-20006/84074482_zpid/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1600 Pennsylvania Ave</a> in Washington, D.C. This 16-bed, 35-bath neoclassical masterpiece is located in a busy neighborhood in the heart of our nation’s capital, with access to schools, Smithsonian museums, and major subway stations. Other amenities include...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A spacious dining room perfect for hosting high-profile guests, like the Prime Minister of Uganda. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A home theater, bowling alley, putting green, and snipers on the roof. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A resolute desk and secluded wings, making it ideal for parents working from home. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what’s the house worth, according to Zillow? Find out the answer below.</p>

The Nasdaq, and tech shares more broadly, popped off. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nELECTION \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/03/2020-presidential-race-big-fat-tbd?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhat Really Matters Is That Everyone Had Fun\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Map of electoral college\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDIxL21hcF9vZl9lbGVjdG9yYWxfY29sbGVnZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNPR\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike your next haircut, house party, or pretty much anything else in 2020, the presidential election is TBD. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere things stand \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of this newsletter’s send time, President Trump had 213 electoral college votes and Joe Biden had 238, per the Associated Press. A candidate needs 270 to win.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBiden \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/u-stock-futures-jump-rally-231812115.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eswept\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e northeastern states while Trump notched wins in typically Republican parts of the South and Midwest. Trump won battlegrounds Florida, Ohio, and Iowa. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Associated Press called Arizona for Biden, the first state to be flipped from its 2016 outcome. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis election saw record turnout, including a crush of mail-in ballots that will \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/11/04/931136905/we-ll-be-working-24-hours-vote-counting-to-continue-through-the-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake time to count\u003c/a\u003e in swing states Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and Michigan—those states don’t allow election officials to get much or any counting done before Election Day. North Carolina, Georgia, and Maine were also too close to call at the Brew’s send time. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reaction:\u003c/strong\u003e President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-elections-us-supreme-court-25762f69b27dfbccc4fd8077fb5fdc91?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efalsely claimed\u003c/a\u003e victory and said he would bring the fight to the Supreme Court, though it’s not clear what that means. Biden advised patience in an address to his supporters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe market reaction\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors are left scratching their heads over calculations around the balance of power between the president and Congress and the likelihood of another round of economic stimulus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlthough many polls favored Biden, the race isn’t playing out decisively in his favor, forcing investors to price in other outcomes on the fly. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt one point last night, betting markets that had long favored Biden swung to favor Trump. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewe could be waiting on ballot counts for days or even weeks, and legal challenges may prolong the process even further. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll 435 seats in the House and 35 in the Senate put their fates in voters’ hands yesterday. Don’t worry, we won’t talk about them all. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eRepublicans went into Election Day with a 53-seat Senate majority. Will Mitch McConnell, who handily won his reelection, return as majority leader? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRepublicans \u003ca href=\"https://apps.npr.org/elections20-interactive/#/senate?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecured 47 seats\u003c/a\u003e as of 6am, and six races are still awaiting final calls (all have GOP incumbents). Other highlights:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSeats in Colorado and Alabama were the first flips, switching to Democrat and Republican, respectively. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNASA astronaut Mark Kelly pulled off a high-profile W for Dems in Arizona, flipping the state.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt least one of Georgia’s Senate races is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/addybaird/georgia-senate-runoff-kelly-loeffler-raphael-warnock?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheading to a Jan. 5 runoff\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, so we may not know the chamber’s final balance of power until then. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe House?\u003c/strong\u003e Democrats \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/politics/republicans-democrats-control-of-house-senate-2020-election?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretained\u003c/a\u003e their majority and may add a few seats. As of 6am, there are 67 races awaiting final results. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe “blue wave” of Democrats some investors were expecting to sweep both chambers \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/stock-market-hope-for-a-blue-wave-election-day-outcome-washes-out-11604472261?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehasn’t materialized\u003c/a\u003e (at least not yet). \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Here are the results from this year’s biggest biz-related ballot measures...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLegal weed: \u003c/strong\u003eNew Jersey and Arizona \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/04/1-in-3-americans-lives-where-recreational-marijuana-legal-434004?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegalized\u003c/a\u003e recreational marijuana use, while South Dakota and Mississippi approved medical marijuana. Now, one in three Americans live in a state where adults can legally buy pot. And Oregon decided to \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2020/11/3/21514828/oregon-drug-decriminalization-measure-110-results?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecriminalize\u003c/a\u003e the use of \u003cem\u003eall \u003c/em\u003edrugs (including heroin and cocaine). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGig economy: \u003c/strong\u003eUber, Lyft, and DoorDash’s hugely expensive Prop 22 \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/04/california-election-voters-prop-22-uber-lyft?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed\u003c/a\u003e in California. The ballot measure directly challenged a recent state law that required these companies to classify their drivers as employees, not independent contractors. Uber and Lyft had warned earlier this year they could suspend their services in CA over the law. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReal estate: \u003c/strong\u003eLet’s go back to California for this one. Prop 15, which would lift longtime tax protections for commercial property owners, is \u003ca href=\"https://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2020/11/04/prop-15-challenge-to-ca-property-tax-rules-trailing-prop-19-wildfire-tax-break-too-early-to-call/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrailing\u003c/a\u003e as of early this morning. The current system puts a tight cap on property tax increases even if the value of the property rises disproportionately. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWork:\u003c/strong\u003e Floridians voted to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wtsp.com/article/news/politics/elections/florida-voters-approve-amendment-2-minimum-wage-hike/67-d9204880-a630-4d40-8a46-658f6e450518?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise\u003c/a\u003e the minimum wage to $15 by 2026 and Colorado will \u003ca href=\"https://www.denverpost.com/2020/11/03/colorado-prop-118-results-paid-family-leave/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestablish\u003c/a\u003e a progressive family and medical leave program. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/03/ant-group-ipo-in-shanghai-suspended.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled off\u003c/a\u003e Ant Group’s extremely un-antish IPO slated for Thursday.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe public debut was expected to be the largest ever, raising at least $34 billion at a valuation north of $310 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnt had planned to list in both Shanghai and Hong Kong, but it nixed Hong Kong after Shanghai pulled out.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s Ant Group again? \u003c/strong\u003eAn affiliate of sprawling Chinese conglomerate Alibaba, Ant is a fintech company...in the same way that Serena Williams is a ping-pong player. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Ant has ruffled some dangerous feathers: the Chinese government’s. In a recent speech, Alibaba cofounder Jack Ma \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/11/03/930799521/regulators-squash-giant-ant-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade critical comments\u003c/a\u003e about the country’s financial regulatory system. Then on Monday, four regulators summoned Ma and Ant Group’s top execs for a chat. We don’t know what was said, but it probably wasn’t “keep criticizing us.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnt Group and the government are frenemies; the Chinese Communist Party \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/03/tech/ant-ipo-postponed-beijing-jack-ma/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewants to cultivate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the country’s capital markets...but not to the point where it’ll tolerate dissent.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking
